Key Match Events: Mahmoud Alaswad gave Syria the lead with a toe-poke shot from the outside of his boot that beat Gurpreet at the first post.
Daleho doubles Syria’s lead as he enters the box from the right and passes it right under Gurpreet, who fails to stop the weak shot.
Pablo taps in the ball inside the net in the 90+6’ minute.
Gurpreet makes a crucial save as Alaa Aladin gets a foot in to the ball that is floated into the box from the corner flag.
Pre-Game Insights: In what will be the Intercontinental Cup decider, India will need to up its game when it takes on the impressive Syrians.

Post-Match Reflections: Manolo Marquez said after the game, “I am angry with the first half...don’t like teams who are scared. The first goal could have been avoided. The scoreline doesn’t paint the real picture, we deserved to score. They killed us in the attack,”
Manolo Marquez said after the game, “Today we still had chances, unlike the last game. We were brave in this second half,”
